content.text:
Use Python to directly check what files exist:

```python
import os
import sys

paths_to_check = [
    '/root/clawd/HEARTBEAT.md',
    '/root/clawd/memory/nba-player-prop-research.md',
    '/root/clawd/memory/mlb-pitcher-prop-research.md',
    '/root/clawd/memory/data-sources.md',
    '/root/clawd/memory/open-source-betting-models.md',
    '/root/clawd/sports-betting/requirements.txt',
    '/root/clawd/sports-betting/src/database.py',
    '/root/clawd/sports-betting/src/data_fetcher.py',
    '/root/clawd/sports-betting/main.py',
]

results = {}
for path in paths_to_check:
    results[path] = os.path.exists(path)

print("FILE EXISTENCE CHECK:")
print("=" * 50)
for path, exists in results.items():
    status = "✓ EXISTS" if exists else "✗ NOT FOUND"
    print(f"{status}: {path}")

# Also check directories
dirs_to_check = [
    '/root/clawd/memory/',
    '/root/clawd/sports-betting/',
]

print("\n" + "=" * 50)
print("DIRECTORY CHECK:")
for dir_path in dirs_to_check:
    exists = os.path.isdir(dir_path)
    if exists:
        files = os.listdir(dir_path)
        print(f"✓ EXISTS {dir_path} - {len(files)} files")
    else:
        print(f"✗ NOT FOUND {dir_path}")
```

This will tell us exactly what actually exists.
